availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Viley (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and shorthorn cattle breeder)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and shorthorn cattle breeder. Paynes Depot, Kentucky, native. Son of Willa Viley and Lydia Smith Viley. Married to Mary Louisa Peak Nuckols Viley. Father of Annie Viley, Lydia Viley, Sallie Viley, Leland Viley, and Willa Viley. Cadet at the Western Military Institute in Georgetown, Kentucky, in 1849. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 58. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 20.
